intro: Launaea cufodontii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces seeds in a capsule. Launaea cufodontii is adapted to survive in harsh environments, storing water in its leaves and stems to reduce water loss.
